law.catch_line: Contributions To Pay Debts; Intent Of Testator
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 31, 2012. Repealed by 2008, 521, Sec. 10. See 2008, 521, Sec. 44 as amended by 2010, 409, Sec. 23 and 2011, 224.] If the testator, by making a specific devise or bequest, has virtually exempted a devisee or legatee from liability to contribute with the others for the payment of the debts, or if by any other provisions in his will he has prescribed or required an appropriation of his estate different from that prescribed in the preceding section, his property shall be appropriated and applied in conformity with his will, so far as such appropriation and application can be made without affecting the liability of his whole estate for the payment of his debts.
